results.title: Report on modernisation
results.creator_credit: British Information Services and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A review of the progress of the modernisation program in all regions of British Railways. Shows how this has affected all aspects of railway work including track improvements, electrification of signalling, new equipment for marshalling yards, erection of bright and functional depots and stations, and the latest coaches and traction units. Facilities for employees in British Railways’ training schools are also illustrated.

results.title: Report on industrial Scotland 1948
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: The central industrial belt of Scotland is traditionally the site of heavy industries - coal, steel, and shipbuilding - which have repeatedly suffered cruelly from alternate booms and slumps. After World War II it was decided to set up a number of light industries in this area, so that the people may have some measure of economic security and continued employment, even when the heavy industries restricted their output.

results.title: Report on Cyprus
results.brief_description: A picture of Cyprus, showing the various developments in agriculture, health and communications and the generally increased prosperity of the country during the seventy-odd years of British administration. The film emphasizes the island’s strategic importance in the defence of the Middle East.

results.title: Report on cancer
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, David Bairstow and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The drama and suspense of impending victory as medical practitioners probe into the mysteries of one of mankind’s most baffling diseases: cancer. The audience is taken to the forefront of the struggle to witness experiments in the field of bio-physics, and the radiation techniques developed for observing cellular activity and malignant growth. A new theory - that cancer may have its beginning with a virus - is discussed by a panel of doctors doing fundamental research at the Ontario Cancer Institute. Patients in this film are played by the Staff of the Princess Margaret Hospital in Toronto.

results.title: Report on British hovercraft
results.creator_credit: Derek Stewart Productions, Gerard Bryant and British Petroleum
results.brief_description: A report on British hovercraft and the capabilities and achievements of various types. Principal operational and technical features of these craft are explained, and the survey shows the operation of passenger services with the Westland SRN 2, and the development of the British-Norman CC2 for commercial operation.

results.title: Report on Borobudur
results.brief_description: The Borobudur Temple in Indonesia was built twelve centuries ago. This most important monument of Buddhism and unique work of art is threatened with imminent destruction. International help is needed to save it. This report by Yemi Lijadu and Francine Vande Wiele was based on a film directed by Theo Van Haren Noman.

results.title: Report on acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Leo Seltzer and Leo Seltzer Associates
results.brief_description: The ancient practice of acupuncture, used for over fifty centuries in the treatment of variety of human ailments, is noted by the narration to be the standard form of medicine for over half the world’s population. Based on the concept that human ills, be they migraine headache, insomnia, backache, deafness and other afflictions, may be cured or eased by the artificial manipulation of certain energy flows in the body. The film covers diagnostic methods, the insertion of needles, their manipulation to increase or decrease the energy flow, the use of herbs used with this treatment. Studies are being conducted in which acupuncture and Western medicine are being integrated for even greater results in the treatment.

results.title: Report
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Union Communication”.
Indication of the dangers faced by employees jumping to incorrect conclusions based on second-hand and unreliable information from the Union delegate about management’s intentions.

results.title: Repetitive strain injuries at work
results.creator_credit: Kim Dalton and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the reasons for repetitive strain injuries and discusses the symptoms and treatment of RSI. Sufferers describe the activities which led to their injuries and doctors talk about methods of prevention.

results.title: Repeater away
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows the laying of the trans-Tasman circuit submarine telephone cable between New Zealand and Australia in 1976. Written and directed by David Haythornthwaite; photography Kerry Brown; sound Julian Ellingworth; commentary Peter Gwynne.
